info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Hardeman, southeastern Haywood, southwestern Madison and west central Chester Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 115 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mercer, or 13 miles southeast of Brownsville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Bemis, Mercer, Medon, Neely, Pinson, Malesus, Parkburg, Hatchie, Madison Hall, Uptonville, Deanburg, Teague, Denmark and Leighton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
